citations.narrative:
In one outdoor enclosure, housing two adult turkey vultures, there is an exposed power cord on the bottom of the
enclosure. Electrical cords pose a significant health risk to birds that may chew or pull on them. Unprotected powered
electrical cords that are within a bird’s enclosure allows access to an electrical hazard that can cause electrocution, injury
and/or death. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that the birds are protected from injury.
To be corrected by 10-11-24
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.153(a)(1)(ii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
In one outdoor enclosure, housing two adult turkey vultures, there is an exposed power cord on the bottom of the 
enclosure. Electrical cords pose a significant health risk to birds that may chew or pull on them. Unprotected powered 
electrical cords that are within a bird’s enclosure allows access to an electrical hazard that can cause electrocution, injury 
and/or death. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that the birds are protected from injury. 
To be corrected by 10-11-24 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
